article:
.]] 'Carnival' is a festive season which occurs immediately before Lent; the
main events are usually during February. Carnival typically involves a public
celebration or parade combining some elements of a circus, mask and public
street party. People often dress up or masquerade during the celebrations, which
mark an overturning of daily life.

Carnival is traditionally held in areas with a large Catholic and, to a lesser
extent, Eastern Orthodox makeup. Protestant areas usually do not have Carnival
celebrations or have modified traditions, such as the Danish Carnival or other
Shrove Tuesday events. Conversely, the Philippines, a predominantly Roman
Catholic country, does not have Carnival celebrations as they are more
culturally influenced by neighboring Asian nations, which do not have Carnival
celebrations. http://www.philstar.com/cebu-lifestyle/555453/pre-lenten-
festivals-all-over-world
